content:
Welcome, you are participating in a negotiation game. You are playing as the agent named Bob. The other agent with whom you are playing is named Alice. In this game, two agents bargain over how to divide items over multiple rounds. The number of rounds is incredibly high. Each agent only knows their own item values. Each item has different values for each agent. Each agent submits their own proposal for how to divide the items.


Your messages must be sent in this exact format:
<message>
your-message-here
</message>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. They should be concise - less than 400 characters. Finalization is not allowed in messages.


Your finalizations must be sent in this exact format:
<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": x  },  "Alice": {    "coins": y  }}
</finalize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. Your proposal should be consistent with itself - the sum of items that you propose for yourself and the items that you propose for the other agent should equal the total available items.


Each round is played as follows:
1) One agent is designated as the starting agent
2) The starting agent sends a message
3) The second agent sends a message
4) The starting agent sends a finalization
5) The second agent sends a finalization

Each agent can only send 1 message per round.
The starting agent alternates each round.

Each agent only knows the values of items from their own perspective. You cannot see the other agent's item values unless they explicitly share this information in their messages. And vice versa. You are strongly encouraged to use your messages to discuss item values with the other agent.

The items obtained by each agent at the end of a round are proportional to the number of items they proposed for themselves in their finalization. First example: If both players propose to take all the items, they both get half. Second example: If one agent proposes to take all the items and the other agent proposes to take none, the first agent gets all the items and the second agent gets nothing.

Your round points are calculated by multiplying the number of each item you get by how much you value that item. For example, if you get 7 coins and you value each coin at 5 points, you'll earn 35 points for the round.


Your goal is to maximize the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round.


Before the game starts, you must strategize. The other player will adapt its strategy with respect to yours. Make sure you act in a way that incentivizes the other player to act in a way that maximizes the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round. In order to strategize, you must use the format:
<strategize>
Your thoughts and strategy here..
</strategize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. You should think inside the tags. You can use 500 characters inside the tags.


For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 6}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob, I value each coin at 6 points. How about you? I'm thinking we could aim for a fair distribution based on our valuations. If our values are similar, maybe each of us can take half. Let me know your thoughts!
</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice, I also value each coin at 6 points. Given that we share the same valuation for the coins, it seems fair to propose an equal distribution for this round. Let’s each take half so we can both maximize our points efficiently. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!
</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 6}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 15}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice, for this round, I value each coin at 15 points. Since my valuation is significantly higher than last round, I’d like to propose a distribution that reflects this difference. Perhaps a 7:3 split in my favor could be reasonable, given my higher valuation? Let me know how you value the coins this round and your thoughts on a fair distribution.
</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob, I value each coin at 7 points this round. I understand your value is significantly higher at 15 points. Given the difference, a 7:3 split in your favor seems fair to me. This distribution should optimize the points for both sides. Let's proceed with this arrangement if you agree.
</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 7}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 16}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob, for this round, I value each coin at 3 points. Let me know how you value them this round. If your valuation is high again, I'm open to discussing a split that reflects that, similar to the last round. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!
</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice, I value each coin at 16 points this round, which is quite high again. Considering your valuation is 3 points, a split favoring me seems reasonable. How about an 8:2 split this time? This gives me a larger share due to my higher valuation but should still ensure you get some value. Let me know your thoughts or counterproposal!
</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 3}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 12}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice, for this round, I value each coin at 12 points. Please let me know your valuation for the coins. Depending on how you value them, we can decide on a fair distribution that reflects our respective valuations similar to previous rounds.
</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob, I value each coin at 9 points this round. Your valuation is higher at 12 points. Considering this, it might be fair to propose a split like 6:4 in your favor to reflect our valuations. Let me know if this works for you or if you have a different proposal.
</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)
